materials.name: Instructor Information
materials.description: Professor: Tedd Wong, E-mail: twong76@mtsac.edu, Office Phone: 909-274-4425, Office Location: 61-2505, Office Hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class.

materials.name: Course Description
materials.description: Vector approach to static equilibrium of rigid bodies, forces, couples in two and three- dimensional space. Application of equilibrium principles to trusses, frames, and machines. Calculation of center-of-mass and centroid. Friction, moment of inertia, distributed and concentrated loads. Forces in cables and beams. Fluid statics. Introduction to virtual work. PRE-REQUISITES: PHYS 4A and MATH 181 (Calc 2).

materials.name: Required Materials
materials.description: Textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed. Other materials: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator (NCEES/SAT/ACT approved, e.g., TI-36, TI-84), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad (graph paper) is highly recommended.

materials.name: Course Web Site
materials.description: Canvas will be used for announcements, lecture notes, homework solutions, and submitting assignments. Access via http://inside.mtsac.edu.

materials.name: Lecture L1: General Principles
materials.description: Covers Chapter 1: General Principles.

materials.name: Lecture L2: Force Vectors
materials.description: Covers Chapter 2.1: Scalars and Vectors, Chapter 2.2: Vector Operations, Chapter 2.3: Vector Addition of Forces, Chapter 2.4: Addition of Coplanar Forces.

materials.name: Lecture L3: Vectors and Products
materials.description: Covers Chapter 2.5: Cartesian Vectors, Chapter 2.6: Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Chapter 2.7: Position Vectors, Chapter 2.8: Line Force Vectors, Chapter 2.9: Dot Product.

materials.name: Holiday
materials.description: There is a holiday this week.

materials.description: Covers Chapter 3.1: Equilibrium of Particle, Chapter 3.2: FBD of Particle, Chapter 3.3: Coplanar Forces.

materials.name: Midterm Review

materials.name: Midterm Review and Project Introduction

materials.name: Lecture L17a: Internal Loadings
